SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.database

Class Broker<T>

java.lang.Object
ca.jolt.database.Broker<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of entity this broker handles.
Direct Known Subclasses:
RestBroker
public abstract class Broker<T> extends Object
An abstract class that serves as a base for database brokers. It provides common functionality for executing SQL queries, mapping results to entities, and handling database connections and transactions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Broker

      protected Broker(String table, Class<T> entityClass)
      Constructs a new Broker instance.
      Parameters:
      table - The name of the database table associated with this broker.
      entityClass - The class type of the entity this broker handles.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If the table name is not a valid SQL identifier.

  • Method Details

    • selectOne

      protected Optional<T> selectOne(String sql, Object... params)
      Executes a SQL query and returns a single result mapped to an entity.
      Parameters:
      sql - The SQL query to execute.
      params - The parameters to bind to the SQL query.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the mapped entity if a result is found, otherwise empty.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If the SQL query is invalid or a database error occurs.

    • selectMany

      protected List<T> selectMany(String sql, Object... params)
      Executes a SQL query and returns a list of results mapped to entities.
      Parameters:
      sql - The SQL query to execute.
      params - The parameters to bind to the SQL query.
      Returns:
      A list of mapped entities.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If the SQL query is invalid or a database error occurs.

    • query

      protected boolean query(String sql, Object... params)
      Executes a SQL update or insert query.
      Parameters:
      sql - The SQL query to execute.
      params - The parameters to bind to the SQL query.
      Returns:
      True if the query affected at least one row, otherwise false.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If the SQL query is invalid or a database error occurs.

    • getReturningId

      protected long getReturningId(PreparedStatement stmt)
      Retrieves the last inserted ID for the current connection after an INSERT operation. This method uses JDBC's standard `RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS` feature to retrieve the generated key.
      Parameters:
      stmt - The PreparedStatement used to execute the INSERT query.
      Returns:
      The last inserted ID, or -1 if no ID was generated or an error occurred.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • getLastAffectedRowCount

      protected int getLastAffectedRowCount(PreparedStatement stmt)
      Retrieves the number of rows affected by the last executed SQL update or insert query.
      Parameters:
      stmt - The PreparedStatement used to execute the query.
      Returns:
      The number of rows affected by the last query, or -1 if the count is unavailable.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • mapToEntity

      protected T mapToEntity(ResultSet rs) throws SQLException
      Maps a ResultSet row to an entity of type T.
      Parameters:
      rs - The ResultSet containing the data to map.
      Returns:
      The mapped entity.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.
      DatabaseException - If an error occurs during the mapping process.
